channel.title: Pets
channel.description:
Hey,i just want to know who else have pets here, and what they are.
i myself have around 40 med fishes, gold fishes, a pair of rabbit and a pair of parrots, and planning on getting a dog probably a german Shepard.
i got the fishes, parrots and the rabbits yesterday :p...yea i suddenly liked having pets, after visiting the zoo for the 50th time lol
so what do you guys have if any

item.title: Pets
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:41, topic:289772”][quote author=PeterMan link=topic=383047.msg2881726#msg2881726 date=1248384211]
My family could have had a farm now if it wasn’t for my dad turning down such a great deal, it was before I was born though.
[/quote]
Aren’t all the farms in Norway expensive as fk and/or on steep hillsides? :P[/quote]
About the hillside part: Nah

The price: He would have gotten it cheap since it was his “new-found” cousin (My dad was adopted) that sold it for a joke of a price. . And this was like in 1975-1980. (I wasn’t born yet)

Also, Off-Topic fun fact I would like to add: I saw through some old photos and found out that my parents were weed smoking hippies in the 70’s.
Oh boy did I rub it in their face all the time.
Not that I have anything against potheads, it was just weird seeing my parents smoke it.

Read full topic

item.title: Pets
item.dc:creator: @Bmaw Bmaw
item.description:
@Bmaw wrote:

I have 3 dogs and 2 cats.

Dog 1: Spatz <3
I have had spatz since my 1st birthday and she is basically the best pet you could ever ask for.
Im surprised she hasnt died yet actually.
She is a cockerspaniel crossed with something we dont know.

Dog 2: Ringo
We just got ringo like a month ago.
We resued him from the SPCA.
He was abused as a puppy so he likes to eat us alot. He got into the garbage 3 times today…

Dog 3: Kiah
We also rescued Kiah.
She is a Siberian Husky with a brown eye and a blue eye.
She’s extremely active and super beautiful

Cat 1: Oscar
Oscar is a pussy… literally.
He hides all day and comes out to poop and eat.
He looks the exact same as our other cat but a fuck of alot skinnier.

Cat 2: Buddy
Buddy’s a pretty sweet cat.
He doesnt like being picked up.
Hes pretty fat and looks just liek oscar but fatter.

Read full topic

item.title: Pets
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:27, topic:289772”][quote author=goatee link=topic=383047.msg2876620#msg2876620 date=1248089794]
I think if you are gonig to get a dog, always get a rescue dog because you are saving it from a previous owner and giving it a new home. And the money goes towards looking after other dogs. There are too many strays out there for people to start buying from breeders.
[/quote]

Absolutely. Pet shops are terrible anyways, most of them are inbred as fuck and come from puppy-mills where the parent dogs are in quite bad condition. I don’t like supporting puppy-mills.

When you go to the shelter, what you do is find the only damn dog there that isn’t barking it’s head off, that’s how you know you got a nice one. Plus you can get them there around 8+ months old and already house-broken. So they don’t shit and piss all over the floor when you bring them home. If they are neutered, and have all their shots, it’ll save you a lot of money too.

I have a dog. Used to have many many many more animals.[/quote]

When I got my dog from the Humane Society (Animal Shelter) it was just a flat rate, and he had to get neutered regardless. Either way, I felt much more satisfied rescuing a dog then I would’ve going to a breeder. Plus rescuing a dog is much cheaper then going to a breeder, which is a huge bonus.

Read full topic
